content.description:
A short, quite fun route up solid limestone, using interesting (and in one or two cases, creepy) holds. The climbing is a bit different than on most 5.8 routes in

Rock Canyon

.

Start up a slopey, slippery, bit of limestone with occasional lichen patches and clip the first bolt. Find small crimps and poor feet to surmount the first almost-bulge.

You'll wonder what the short, overhanging head wall ahead is doing on a 5.8. Find the holds and then pull over it. The chains are up and left a bit.
content.protection: 4 bolts, chain anchors. Extend the anchor with slings if you plan on top roping it. The chains can't be seen from the ground.
content.location:
Located about 15 feet to the left of

Good for Your Soul

, which is the left route on the main face of

Boingo Wall

, and which starts just to the right of the large tree.

content.description:
A rightward-curving route that consists of mostly rough slopers with an occasional rounded crimp, then finally a welcome short crack and flake edge to the chains.

There are hollow-sounding holds between first and second bolts, but nothing came off. The rest of the route is solid . The hard part for me was getting to and clipping the third bolt.
content.location:
The middle route on

Boingo Wall

. Starts just to the right of the tall tree.

content.description: I bolted this about the same time as Good For Your Soul.  Rob did the FA.  Bouldery and, sorry, one of my first bolt jobs so the bolts are not in great places.  Bring a long draw for the crux unless you're burly.  I wasn't.
